result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MEGAN J CROW

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:27 am. Atty. Gregory Parker appeared in person, on behalf of State of WI. Atty. Stockbridge appeared via zoom on behalf of M. Crow, Defandant. Atty. Kolell appeared in person on behalf of M. Crow, Defendant. Megan Crow, Defendant appeared via zoom (i/c). Atty. Kolell updates the Court. Defense is looking to do a mental health evaluation on the Defendant. Atty. Stockbridge addresses the Court-she is in agreement with Atty. Kolell's statement. Atty. Parker addresses the Court - indicating that an evaluation was done back in June & the Defendant was found to be competent. The Court will schedule one more Final Pre-Trial in this matter.  FPT scheduled for 11-18-2022 at 9am.

Off. R. Frechette sworn & testifies. Witness id's DE. Cross-exam.  Det. D. Conradt sworn & testifies. Cross-exam.  Closing statements. Court finds probable cause, binds the matter over for trial.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with Capital Credit Union or it's property.  Stay at least 1,000 feet away from that facility.    No travel outside the state without prior court approval.  No possession of any edge instrument with a blade longer than 2 inches exceipt in the defendan't own kitchen.   No contact with JRG 6-18-83

01:18 PM Defendant MEGAN J CROW in court with attorney Carly Foor.  Defendant MEGAN J CROW in custody, via zoom.   Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for PD services, not sure who will represent yet.  State is requesting $50,000 cash bond.  Willing to waive time limits until she has an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
